channel.title: Webclient issue, Rep++
channel.description: I normally have no issues with creating a webclient. I will list what i've done, if I did anything wrong please correct me. I uploaded the cache to dropbox, then I pasted the new cache link into the cachedownloader and the client.java, I didn't rename the cache so I didn't bother messing with signlink. What happens is the cache loads all the way then says "error loading please report"

item.title: Webclient issue, Rep++
item.dc:creator: @zach55200 zach55200
item.description:
@zach55200 wrote:

oxygen-_:

So you just went to update the cache and stuff and it started doing that?

Yes, it doesn’t make sense, all I did was change the links and re-name the cache… There is no problem with how I zipped my cache

Read full topic

item.title: Webclient issue, Rep++
item.dc:creator: @zach55200 zach55200
item.description:
@zach55200 wrote:

[quote=“oxygen-_, post:10, topic:427331”]Alright…For the cache packaging. Lets say my cache is in c:/btkcache1/…I want to go to my desktop, right click, new, new zip archive.
then i want to rename it to btkcache1…open the C:/btkcache1/ and copy all the files that are in it, NOT THE FOLDER, just the folders and files INSIDE the btkcache1 folder. You want to drag those right into the btkcache1.zip that’s on your desktop. then you upload that, copy the link, put it in your client, and walah.

Do you get what i mean? and if you get some stupid java error on your webclient, delete all the class files, not the folders but the class files inside the folders and re compile the whole client. then jar it again.

well i’m just looking for rep so if this doesnt help reply again.[/quote]
You just dumbed down what wet said, and besides i’ve tried all of this already.

Read full topic

item.title: Webclient issue, Rep++
item.dc:creator: @oxygen1 oxygen-_
item.description:
@oxygen1 wrote:

Alright…For the cache packaging. Lets say my cache is in c:/btkcache1/…I want to go to my desktop, right click, new, new zip archive.
then i want to rename it to btkcache1…open the C:/btkcache1/ and copy all the files that are in it, NOT THE FOLDER, just the folders and files INSIDE the btkcache1 folder. You want to drag those right into the btkcache1.zip that’s on your desktop. then you upload that, copy the link, put it in your client, and walah.

Do you get what i mean? and if you get some stupid java error on your webclient, delete all the class files, not the folders but the class files inside the folders and re compile the whole client. then jar it again.

well i’m just looking for rep so if this doesnt help reply again.

Read full topic

item.title: Webclient issue, Rep++
item.dc:creator: @Brandontan Brandontan
item.description:
@Brandontan wrote:

you don’t add your cache bro just you .class files from your server, and then add the entire client over when jarring.

Read full topic

item.title: Webclient issue, Rep++
item.dc:creator: @zach55200 zach55200
item.description:
@zach55200 wrote:

[quote=“Wet Dreamss, post:7, topic:427331”]Then try this.

Right click your desktop, click new, and create new ZIP archive.

Open it up, drag everything INSIDE your cache folder into the ZIP. Then upload it after name it. Remeber. The names in Signlink.java ARE case sensetive[/quote]
didnt work

Read full topic

item.title: Webclient issue, Rep++
item.dc:creator: @Wet_Dreamss Wet Dreamss
item.description:
@Wet_Dreamss wrote:

Then try this.

Right click your desktop, click new, and create new ZIP archive.

Open it up, drag everything INSIDE your cache folder into the ZIP. Then upload it after name it. Remeber. The names in Signlink.java ARE case sensetive

Read full topic

item.title: Webclient issue, Rep++
item.dc:creator: @zach55200 zach55200
item.description:
@zach55200 wrote:

Wet Dreamss:

Did you upload it the Public folder in drop box, i had that problem at first.

I added it to the public folder, and I don’t have any client sided problems. I know that for sure.

Read full topic

item.title: Webclient issue, Rep++
item.dc:creator: @chillwitm888 chillwitm888
item.description:
@chillwitm888 wrote:

zach55200:

I normally have no issues with creating a webclient. I will list what i’ve done, if I did anything wrong please correct me. I uploaded the cache to dropbox, then I pasted the new cache link into the cachedownloader and the client.java, I didn’t rename the cache so I didn’t bother messing with signlink. What happens is the cache loads all the way then says “error loading please report”

I think it’s either how you set the manifest while you were zipping the client or how you packaged your cache

Read full topic
